title: The impossible job made possible? How head coach Rassie Erasmus helped revive Springbok fortunes
text:
With the exception of No 10 Downing Street, no office chews up its incumbents and spits them out with such regularity as that of South Africa head coach.

Jake White was pushed out after winning the 2007 World Cup, Heyneke Meyer spent most of the 2015 tournament on the verge of an emotional breakdown while his successor Allister Coetzee lasted less than two years in the role. The Poisoned Chalice, a book by respected South African journalist Gavin Rich, details how even the brightest coaches get broken down by a combination of sky-high expectations and internecine political machinations. ...
